page.title: 08AGRICULTURE Market gardening
page.content: This is really an extension of arab_ le farming(and benefits from the same climatic and physical factors),but sp_ ecialised.There are few examples of this in the area,but they deserve men_ tion.Proximity to markets(eg Oswestry) is very important,due to the perish_ able nature of the produce.Grown here are sage(planted April,picked Nov), sprouts(planted Jan,picked May),leeks (planted Jan,picked April_May),beans_ runner,stick and broad_(planted April, picked Sept),salad onions(planted Apr_ il,picked Oct),spring cabbage(planted July,picked Dec),asparagus(picked May) ,gooseberries and strawberries(picked June).Land is ploughed in winter.Spr_ aying against weeds and pests takes place May_Sept;the most important part of the season.Growing a variety of cr_ ops protects farmers from a drop in prices or a bad climatic year.
